item.title: Apparent Images Of The Next Star Wars Game Surface
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/apparent-images-of-the-next-star-wars-game-surface/1100-6530508/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new Star Wars game is being revealed soon, and some images from it have apparently emerged online. The images are supposedly taken from the Star Wars strategy game developed by Bit Reactor. The studio was founded by former XCOM developers and partnered with Respawn Entertainment on the project.

Found by MP1st, these images were spotted in a Bit Reactor artist's portfolio. They're dated back to 2023, so it's possible that they aren't up to date. However, it does provide us a glimpse of what the project might look like. According to MP1st, the game's codename is "Bruno" and the screenshots suggest that it's an isometric tactics game.

Some of the screenshots show gameplay where Mandalorians and a droid take cover while others depict the user interface. One shows what looks like the hub area, called Kafrene Mining Colony.

As these images are over a year old, it's also possible that the final release could look drastically different. The official Star Wars website states that there will be a first look at Respawn and Bit Reactor's project during Star Wars Celebration in Japan on April 19.

This Star Wars project is not the only one in the works right now. Saber Interactive is working on a Knights of the Old Republic remake, Quantic Dream is working on Star Wars: Eclipse, and Skydance New Media is working on an unannounced Star Wars game with director Amy Hennig.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
